inn1.comm: starts with a length ball on off, slight shape away, pushed away to cover
big wide down the leg side

Diamond duck for Watling. Nicol has sold him down the river. Pushes to short midwicket, takes three-four solid strides down the wicket, and then says no. Watling has nowhere to go but to hope that Waller misses. Waller hits the stumps direct
wide outside off now, swinging too far away
half-volley outside off, driven down to mid-off
defended with an open face
length ball outside off, pushes forward and defends to cover
slowish delivery, length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, quick, into the ribs, beats him for the pace. That's a good start
stays short of a length, pushed to cover
good pace, outside off, left alone, the keeper collects in front of his chest
another chance for a run-out. Sibanda makes a diving save at point, there is confusion between the batsmen, but Sibanda loses the ball just as he is about to throw
short and wide, cut away in front of point. Finds the gap superbly
left alone outside off
McCullum goes aerial, and hits it well over mid-off. Just the pace to hit, just the length to get under. Clean connection made
driven along the ground this time, to mid-on
full outside off, takes the thick edge with some swing, to the right of third man, who is fine enough to keep them down to one
tries the inswinger this time, full it is, and is pushed to cover
eased away for four. A wide swinging half-volley, Nicol presses half-forward and caressed between mid-off and extra cover. Not only does he look like Guptill, he also drives like him
gets a thick edge to third man on this drive
Nicol charges at him, swats across the line, and is lucky to make no contact with this short-of-a-length ball
stays in the crease this time, the ball skids onto him, defended to leg
worked away off the hip for one
shaping up to pull, the ball doesn't come on, ends up hitting a two-handed forehand wide of mid-off
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
stays short of a length, on off, no room, defended
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot

how has that missed everything? Swings and dips at him, ends up being a yorker, just outside off. McCullum is over-balanced too, but it sneaks through the keeper's pads too. A really tough stumping missed
clipped off the pads for a couple
leading edge this time, McCullum turns the bat face early, the ball holds its line a touch, but it doesn't carry to point
driven well, but straight to mid-off
driven handsomely again, but finds mid-on
short of a length, on the pads, and Nicol plays a Guptill-like pick-up pull. I want somebody to trace back to their early days, and see why Guptill and Nicol look like each other
stays short of a length, but corrects the line. Defended just outside off

lovely catch by Sibanda to give Ncube a maiden ODI wicket. Not that this is what you can call a fielder's wicket alone. Ncube stays short of a length even as Nicol charges at him, the bounce and the line cramp him up, and he ends up slicing it square on the off side. Sibanda runs back from point - turns around and runs - and takes it over his shoulder
McCullum is not erring on the side of caution. Not just as yet. This is short and wide, doesn't quite come on, but he cuts it in front of square. Over the infield
a more orthodox cut shot, but just as brutal. This time he waits for it and cuts it over point
length ball outside off, pushes forward to defend this back to the bowler
Taylor hits a four first ball. This is a wide half-volley and takes some reaching, but reach out he does, and place it between cover and cover-point
this is closer to off, and is respectfully played back
defended off the front foot again
short of a length, around off, swinging away, gets Taylor to push at it away from the body, takes the edge, but it is short and wide of slip
fuller, close to off, pushes forward and pushes the ball to long-off for one
clipped away off the pads

that's a ripper, lovely bowling from the debutant. Short of a length outside off, kicks off and holds its line. McCullum is drawn into pushng at it, and is done in by the straightening of the ball. Huge appeal right away, McCullum doesn't walk, but the umpire sends him on his way. A thin edge it seems like
stays short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
length ball, on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
Ryder drives at this length ball without any feet, is beaten by the angle across him
another beauty here, fairly rapid, just short of a driving length, on middle and off, seams away slightly. Ryder's feet don't move again, and is beaten again
short of a length, outside off, punched away wide of cover
Ryder presses forward and drives with an open face, gets close to the line this time, but can't beat point
inswinger now, starts outside leg, ends up middle and off, defended watchfully
short of a length, on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket for one
easy delivery, a half-volley on the pads, Taylor capitalises with a flick past midwicket
length ball, on off, right forward to defend
length ball, outside off, holding its line, hits the outside half of the bat, goes along the ground to point
short, skids on him, gets a bottom edge on the pull, but Ryder is safe
over-pitched on off, nicely driven, but can't beat mid-off
much better from Ryder. Get a length ball outside off, doesn't move his feet too much, but comes half forward to get close to the line, and drives it through extra cover. All along the ground
half forward again, but this time in defence
length ball outside off, angling in, defended with an open face
Ryder' wrists. It's a half-volley on the pads. Ryder hardly seems to have hit it, but the flick carries almost all the way for a six
wide of the crease, holds its line against the angle, defended respectfully by Taylor
slower through the air, draws him forward, played watchfully again
another forward defensive
this one holds into the surface a bit, and turns too. But because it starts from leg, and a touch short, it is easy to work it away for a single
short of a length, on the pads, clipped away on the up, gets a single to deep square
nicely flighted, middle and off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, outside off, left alone
this one doesn't bounce much outside off, shoulders arms to it
length ball, angling in towards off, defended off the front foot
angling too far down leg, but he fails to make contact and is hit on the pad
leans into this drive outside off, but can't beat cover
short of a length, wide outside off, Taylor decides against cutting, hoping it will be called a wide. The border-line decision goes with the bowler this time. Good to see
short of a length, turning in towards middle, pushed to midwicket
defended to that straightish midwicket again
places this one wide of that man at midwicket, gets a single
punches this outside off, can't beat extra cover
angling into the pads, misses with the flick, but takes a leg-bye
pitched up outside off, defended back to the bowler
the loosener is short and wide, but he has got protection at sweeper-cover
punched away to cover, can't find the gap
wide down the leg side
stays leg side again, on a length, and Ryder flicks it beautifully, wide of deep midwicket, gets four for it
angling outside off now, punched to extra cover
length ball outside off, driven to extra cover
clipped away off the pads for a single to deep square
overpitched on off, driven to long-on for one
angled into the pads, defended to midwicket
flighted outside off, defended back to the bowler
short of a length, pushed to midwicket
presses forward to try and work this to leg, but can't beat midwicket
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
length ball, on middle and leg, pushed past the bowler for one to mid-on
length ball, on the pads, can't find a gap on the leg side
full and wide, Ryder throws his bat at it. Misses, and Chigumbura is lucky to get away with this. Not least because it is not called a wide
short of a length, close to off, punched back to the bowler
short of a length, outside off, doesn't quite come on, hit back to the bowler
driven straight down, but can't beat a diving mid-off
flighted outside off, pushed to long-on for one
flicked away square on the leg side
punched back to the bowler
comes forward to work this away for a single into the leg side
there comes the Taylor slog-sweep. It was always a matter of when and not if. Goes square of deep midwicket with this one
pushed straight to midwicket, wants a quick single, a direct-hit there would have run Ryder out
pushed to deep cover off the front foot
pushed off the front foot towards the bowler
short of a good length on the off, chips it in the direction of mid-off
lands safely, Ryder got his foot outside off and tried to dispatch it over square leg but ended up getting a top edge that fell safely behind short fine
pitched up outside off, drilled towards mid-off, they clinch a single as he dives to his right
goodish length on middle, turned wide of square leg for a single to keep strike
shortish just outside off, cut away straight to point
tossed up on middle, pushes it gently back to the bowler
closes the face on that one and rolls it wide of mid-on, quicker through the air from Price
beautifully timed by Ryder, stepped out to that flighted delivery, got to the pitch and launched it over mid-off, it carried all the way, seemed just like a chip
turned past midwicket into the deep for a single
fullish on the off, pushed straight to extra cover
good length on the off, rocks forward and defends it towards mid-off
shortish outside off and Ryder latches onto it, slaps it wide of extra cover into the deep for a couple
good length on the off, drives it through the line to mid-off
short, too short, on the off stump, it's fish and chips for Ryder, swats it hard over the bowler's head for a boundary, both mid-on and mid-off are up
slashes hard at that one, trying to dispatch it through point, misses
straying in line is Chigumbura, down the leg side and Ryder helps it past short fine leg for a couple of runs, came off the pads in fact, called leg-byes 100 up
flighted on middle, lands full and Taylor pushes it back to the bowler
shortish outside off, much flatter through the air, tries to cut past point, misses
pushes it down the ground towards long-on for a single
slightly short on leg stump, turns towards middle, defended back to the bowler
good start to his international career, begins with a maiden, played back down the pitch
eased down the ground towards long-off for a single
flighted on the off stump, gets across and drives it back to the bowler
fetches it from outside off and sweeps it down to deep square leg
Ryder steps out and Waller keeps it flat, doesn't quite get to the pitch, adjusts well and defends to extra cover
patted back gently towards the bowler
steps outside off, waits for it to turn in and sweeps it down to long leg for a single to keep strike
runs it down with an open face
full outside off, driven to long-off for one
legbreak, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
flat, on the pads, misses on the flick
flicks this from in front of off, to midwicket
turning into the pads, beats Ryder's closed face to hit his pad
wide of the crease, tossed up, driven to long-on for one
punched down the ground, uppishly past the outstretched hand of the bowler
defended to leg
Ryder has backed up too far and Taylor has hit this straight to straight midwicket. Despite the dive, Ryder was gone had Sibanda hit direct
defended to extra cover
looks to turn this to leg, can't beat straight midwicket
length ball, on the pads, worked away to deep square
short of a length, turning away from around off, punched to long-on for one
pitched up on the pads, worked away for an easy single
worked away off the pads for a single
overpitched on the pads, another single accrues
length ball outside off, turns away slightly, left alone
Waller makes a fine diving save to his right to save a single here
lovely lovely shot from Jesse. Takes a step towards the line of the ball and chips it nonchalantly over extra cover
angling into the pads, defended back
length ball, middle and off, holding its line, defended back
short of a length, on the pads, punched down the ground
offbreak into the pads, can't beat midwicket
flighted outside off, driven to cover
short of a length, outside off, hit back to the bowler
full, middle and leg, can't beat midwicket
quicker ball, turns into the pads, beats the bat
swept away from outside off, Ryder reaches fifty, and acknowledges the mild applause
flat, pitches outside leg, turns towards leg, defended
Ryder gives him the charge, takes it on the full, drives it to long-off for one
Ryder charges out too, Waller pulls the length back, Taylor has to recover and push it to sweeper-cover
Ryder tries to chip over extra cover again, but ends up hitting it much straighter than he wants.  Natsai M'shangwe from long-off makes a diving effort but can't get to it
Leading edge. This seems to be angling into the pads, I don't see much turn, but Ryder has closed the face a touch early, and lobs back an easy return catch. Ryder is slow as Inzi on his walk back
length ball outside off, turning in, can't beat midwicket
punched away square on the leg side for one
flighted on off, driven to long-off for one
another drive to long-off
this is slower through the air, turns a bit too, pushed to extra cover
pitches middle and leg, turning away, punched down to long-off for one
left alone outside off, this was pushed through
short, late-cut away, but Price makes a diving save at short third man to keep them down to one
looks to late-cut this, but can't get it fine
full outside off, driven to extra cover
looks for a single in the leg side, can't beat square leg
long hop, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
full, on the pads, can't beat the straight midwicket
looks to tip and run, but Taibu is quick and denies them the single
full outside off, can't beat cover with the attempt at drive
driven down the ground, but can't get it past the outstretched left hand of the bowler
a wide half-volley, he drives with an open face, but is beaten
too straight, but it doesn't turn and beats the inside edge of Taylor's bat
another diving save off his own bowling, to his left, denies him the single
full and straight, played back to him
short of a length, turning in, pushed to midwicket
shimmies down the track, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, hits along the ground to long-on
nicely executed late-cut, it is short and wide, Williamson makes room and hits it past point
this over is taking all the pressure off. Another long hop, and he has pulled it away between deep square and deep midwicket
flighted on off, worked past midwicket for one
driven to long-on
punched down to long-on
too straight again, concedes a single to long-on
too full this time, a single to long-off accrues now
wide full toss, could have been called, but he pushes at it with an open face, wide of deep point
pushed to midwicket for a single, but Sibanda throws wide to allow more
full, driven square with an open face
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-on for one
punched down to long-off for one
fired down the leg side, and they take a single off the ricochet off Taibu's gloves too
arm ball, punched to leg, but can't beat the straight midwicket
slows it down, flights it generously, defended to extra cover
pushed down to long-on for one now
that's a wide down the leg side. Oh wait, it hasn't been called. Taylor is surprised, and so am I. The umpire reckons it hit the pad on the way. I didn't see any such event
driven to sweeper-cover for one
opens the face on this to take a single to point
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
overpitched, opens the face on this, but Taylor is quick at cover to cut the single
slow through the air, gets turn on it, takes the edge, but wide of the keeper
full on off, and he dives to his left to save another single
fired in outside off, beats the cut
arm ball, length ball, angling in, pushed back to Price
cramps him up again, hit to straight midwicket
makes room this time to punch it square from in front of the stumps
Taylor tries the big sweep first ball, Price fires it in full and straight, Taylor gets a huge top edge on the low full toss, but it clears Masakadza who is running back from square leg
hits this sweep all right, along the ground, past square leg. Taylor is warming up. Taylor raises his bat because the scoreboard at the ground shows he is 50. He is not
Williamson seems to have moved too far across but gets bat on it, past square leg
takes a single to midwicket to bring up his fifty, but he think he is 51 and doesn't raise the bat
KW moves across again, Meth tries to go behind him, but ends up bowling a wide
moves across again, flicks a low full toss, but Taibu makes a full-length diving save at short fine leg
Taylor stands his ground and strikes across the line of this, but can't beat midwicket
full on the pads, driven to long-on for one

lucky runs here, KW tries to slog one form outside off, gets a thick inside edge between the keeper and short fine, but Taibu saves two runs with his electric chase. I can't think of too many other fielders who would have fielded this
fired into the pads pushed to midwicket
hit into the leg side, but he has both deep square and deep midwicket for Taylor
full, into the pads, concedes just a leg-bye
Taylor looks to make room, but Price fires this in again, cramping him up. Hit back to the bowler
gets inside the line of this one, hitting it between deep square and deep midwicket
this one is angled too far down and is called a wide
pushed to mid-on to keep strike
Taylor slogs, and you can;t afford to bowl length when he is doing that. Lofts this over midwicket. His hockey hands into the act
full now, doesn't let him get under it, just the single to long-on

appeal for lbw as he moves across and is hit on the pad. It has hit him in line, it is pretty full, but the umpire signals no leg-bye. I don't see any inside edge, though, the bat seems to have hit the ground, though
full, straight, hit to long-on for one
for a change tries to go over cover. Makes room this time, gets a length ball, drives at it, gets a thick edge, which flies between point and short third man
tries the square-drive, but can't get it past point
goes inside-out, mis-hits it, but manages to clear mid-off

makes room first, then goes inside the line of a fast leg-side full toss, hits the sweep in the air, Masakadza runs to his right from deep square, makes a full-length dive, gets one hand to it, but can't hold on
cuts this from well outside leg, can't beat point
makes room again, cuts from in front of off, beats point, gets a couple
moves across the line to shovel this low full toss to the left of Waller at deep midwicket. He gets a hand to it, but can't stop four
pulled away wide of deep square for a couple
walks across the stumps, swipes this to deep square for one
another single to deep square leg
shuffles across again but misses out on a full toss, will take the leg-bye
wide down the leg side, trying to go behind the batsman who is forever moving across
low full toss, lofts it towards deep midwicket, but it bounces short
full on off, a near yorker, hit to his left for one, Chigumbura makes a dive, but he doesn't collect the ball on the dive, merely stops it. They run through
back away this time, Elton follows him with a low full toss, hit wide of deep square
cramps him up with one quick delivery
chips down the track, Price slows it down, he ends up pushing to midwicket
tries the big sweep, gets a bottom edge for one
fired in on middle and off, hit back to the bowler
leaves the crease to chip this down the ground for one
into the pads, worked away for a single
flat on, off, turning slightly away, pushed to cover
Taylor tries the big slow sweep, inside-edges onto his pad
the hockey hands again, moves across, gets low, slog-sweeps this length ball over the shorter boundary, which is deep midwicket when bowling from this end
Taylor is waiting for the lenght correction. He just sits back to use the pace on this shortish delivery, placing it between point and short third
slog sweep this time, but this is along the ground, and gets him just the single
looks to go over cover, but it is too full, he can't get under it, and ends up pushing it back
this had a touch of Murphy to it. All that could go wrong did. A wide down the leg side hits the foot holes and explodes over the keeper's head
that's fifty for KW, with a pull past deep square leg. He has been smooth during the innings, making sure NZ didn't stall after Ryder's wicket
another wide down the leg side, that's 10 runs off 1 ball on his return spell
short of a length, on off, no room, hit back to the bowler
moves across the line to try and scoop, he tries to go behind with him, but ends up with another wide
makes room to punch this, and B Taylor's misfield at extra cover allows them the single
short of a length, worked away off the hip for one
short, middle and leg, he moves away and pulls past midwicket, all along the ground. Powerful hit
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
length ball, middle and leg, he has moved across to sweep it to short fine leg
full toss on the pads, with fine leg in the circle, Taylor accepts the freebie
walks down the track to take this on the full, but gets an inside edge on it. Will be just the single
well bowled, yorks KW who is charging at him. A well-earned dot
another yorker, digs it out for a single
full outside off, driven to the right of deep point for a couple
slightly short, slightly wide, he rocks back and cuts it in front of square. Powerfully done
dropped off his own bowling, tries to hit down the ground, doesn't get the elevation, but he can't hold onto a high chance to his left
cut away to backward point for one
punched square for another single
poor fielding at short third man. Late-cuts this, to the right of short third man, and Ncube comes down on this like an old lady, letting it through
cut away to reach his hundred. Removes the helmet, and holds his arms aloft. The NZ gallery acknowledges the effort
driven to extra cover for a single, B Taylor misfields
length ball, gets down on a knee, and slogs this between long-on and deep midwicket - 150 for the partnership
gets a low full toss, but mis-hits it to deep midwicket. Falls in front of the man
full on off, near yorker, driven to the left of sweeper-cover for two
a near-yorker on the pads, will be just a single
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
yorker on off, squeezed out for a single

low full toss, hit to deep midwicket in the longer part of the ground, Taylor wants the second, and is in danger of being run-out. Waller's throw is flat and full, and not too wide, but Taylor makes in the extra time it takes to collect and whip the bails off. The referral to third umpire earns him a break
good yorker, follows him, cramps him up, just the leg-bye
wide yorker, can't do much more than it except the single to extra cover
another good yorker, follows him to cramp him up, concedes just the leg-bye
A superb over ends in a poor ball. A rib-high full toss that is not only scooped fine for four but is also called a no-ball for height
yorks him outside leg, dug out for a single to long-on
length ball, don't do that at the death. KW goes down on a nee, and slog-sweeps him as he would a spinner
this is in the block hole, and goes just for a single
Meth has got it all wrong under pressure. Trying the yorker, bowls a juicy fill toss, and Hockey Hands sends it way over deep midwicket
this is better, a near yorker outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
length outside off, slog-swept between deep midwicket and long-on, all along the ground
length again, but this time KW finds long-on. That, though, keeps him on strike, eight short of a hundred now
low full toss, no room, driven straight to extra cover
yorker, digs it out, wide of deep midwicket, comes back for two
short of a length, Taylor stands there and pulls it between deep midwicket and long-on. KW running out of balls to try to get a hundred

Taylor is bowled, which also means KW won't get a hundred. Back to Taylor, though. It's a lenght ball, the kind he sometimes hits for sixes blindfolded. But he misses this, and the middle stump goes for a walk
lofted over mid-off, a teasing skier, Taibu runs back, but with Hamilton Masakadza in vicinity he takes his eye off it, and drops it

KW gets a second bite of the cherry. He gets a no-ball last ball. It's a high full toss, and the top edge goes over short third man for four. Ncube is taken off after a second beamer, and KW gets another shot at the hundred. Funny little game, is this

puts in the dive to complete a superb hundred. This is a short ball, but doesn't quite come on, and he ends up punching it over mid-off. Taibu gives it the chase, but the batsmen run hard and come back for three. Taibu's throw is by the stumps, but KW puts a big dive in in the home stretch. The whole dressing room is on its feet. And James writes in, "So Kane is Abel to get a 100 despite being n'squared up by a n'ball from N'Cube? Very c'nfusing!"

inn2.comm: flighted outside off, driven back off the inside half of the bat

this is catching practice really. There is a short midwicket in place, the ball is flighted on middle and off, it is turning, and with the turn he offers a simple catch to B McCullum to make it an all McCullum dismissal. Unlike Watling, though, Sibanda gets a regulation, non-exotic duck
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
turning into the pads, worked away for a single past square leg
tossed up outside off, can't beat extra cover
now middle and leg, slower through the air, Masakadza presses forward to defend
short of a length, outside off, punched away, but can't beat cover
holds its line outside off, left alone
fuller, angling in towards off, solidly defended back to him
moves inside the line of a length ball, pushed it wide of midwicket for one
short, wide, cuts away, not past point
short of a length, extra bounce, hits him on the thigh
Taylor goes after N McCullum, giving him the charge and lofting a full ball over mid-on. That's the right intent
the arm ball, skids through, stays low, defended from deep inside the crease
half chance for McCullum. Taylor is looking to chip this over the bowler's head, which he does but not by much. N McCullum goes high in the air but can't make it
flicked away off the pads, wide of deep square
defended to cover this time
Taylor is getting stuck into N McCullum. Leaves the crease again, is not close to the pitch of the ball, but goes through with the shot, lofting it comfortably over mid-on
short of a length outside off, stays low, beats the bottom edge
looks to drive away from the body, gets a thick edge onto the pad
slight shape away, outside off, left alone
looks to step out of the crease, Aldridge bowls short, hits him on the thigh
pulled away off the front foot, keeps it down, gets a single to deep square
short of a length, outside off, Taylor moves too far across the stumps, and hits this with the inside half of the bat
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
pushed through across him, beats the outside edge with the angle
huge appeal as Taylor goes across the line and is hit in front of off. Good decision because the ball hasn't turned and is sliding with the angle to miss off
defended back to the bowler
leaves the crease with defence on mind, plays it back to the bowler
looks to turn this around the corner, but can't beat short fine leg
walks down the crease, rides the bounce of this and tucks it away off the hip
looks to punch this outside off, plays away from the body, and ends up playing outside the line of the ball. Pure misjudgement of the line of the ball
moves across to drive this on the up, can't beat mid-off
slower ball, on a length outside off, he is early into the shot, drags it towards mid-on for one
half-volley outside off, driven crisply to mid-off, takes B McCullum on, and the fielder misses. He was a goner had BMac hit the stumps
punched wide of mid-off this time, gets an easy single
fires this in, forces an advancing Taylor to play a defensive shot
that's a full toss on the pads, and he gets low to sweep this over short fine leg
arm ball, across him, wide of off, Taylor pushes at it, and gets a half-edges-half-guides it past slip, and fine of short third man
short of a length outside off, pushed to long-on for one
hit softly to mid-off for one
lovely shot. He knows the long-on is back, so goes over mid-off this time. Doesn't try to hit too hard, just chips this length ball over the man. Is timed well enough to go for four
short of a length, pulled straight to midwicket, Nicol, who demolishes the stumps at the striker's end. Masakadza, though, is in
short of a length, wide, Masakadza punches without feet. Doesn't make any contact
slightly fuller, closer to off, left alone
leaves the crease, dabs it past point for one
moves outside off, Oram bowls short and outside off. Taylor looks to work this to leg, but can't do enough with it, and Oram does the fielding
no feet. Short and wide, he goes after it, but the ball moves away slightly to beats the edge
short of a lenght, outside off, defended to cover
Top shot. This isn't quite a long hop, but he has pulled it off the front, between mid-on and midwicket. All along the ground
fuller, stays outside off, left alone
full and wide, picks out extra cover with the drive
thick edge on this drive, but it flies between cover-point and cover
slower ball, starts just outside off, left alone
wide, Taylor moves across to get close to the line, and punches this past point
moves across again, Oram stays wide, and this time he leaves it alone
punched away this time, but can't beat gully
short of a length, looks to drop and run, but the close-in fielders on off pounce on it. Has to go back
Taylor wins this round the cat-and-mouse. Moves across again, Oram tries to out-wide again, but Taylor drags this length ball from outside off and lofts it over square leg
punched away through the crowded off-side field. N McCullum gives chase, and keeps them down to three
tossed up outside off, smashed back to him
full, flicked away to long-on for one
flighted again, driven straight to extra cover
flight again, pitches on a length, driven to long-on for one
moves across to cover the line, then works this wide of midwicket for one
tossed up again, looks to go leg, but can't beat the straight midwicket
slow through the air, not much turn, dropped to leg and they take a single
tries the reverse-sweep, front-edges it in front of square for one
lovely shot, backs away and chips this from well outside leg, over extra cover
tossed up outside leg, Taylor sweeps, misses, hit on the pad
and he misses on the sweep again, hit on the pad, in front of leg
wants to flick, hit on the pad again. Taylor getting itchy. Nearly commits too far for a suicidal single before making it back
overpitched, on the pads, single to long-on
comes down the track, yorks himself up, takes a single to long-on
short of a length, turning in towards off, punched down to long-on for one

top shot to get to his fifty. Flighted outside off, Taylor gets close to it, close enough to feel safe with going across the line, for a flat six over midwicket. The crowd - not huge, but appreciable - loves it
pushed to long-on for one
flighted outside off, the open face places it wide of cover
length ball, on off, punched, Woodcock makes a diving save to his left
slower through the air, Masakadza has chipped down the track, and has to abort the aggressive shot. Defended to leg
angling in, driven to long-on for one
pitches outside leg, lets it hit his pad

stands well outside leg, and then sweeps it wide of deep square, where Aldridge makes a brilliant save. The ball has crossed the rope in the air when his lunge pulls it back in, even as he himself falls over the fence
worked away into the leg side for a single
and Taylor attacks him first ball, hitting him to deep midwicket where a fumble allows them the second
flighted outside off, turning in, defended to leg
quicker, flatter, on off, beats the flick, hits the pad
short of a length, bunted wide of midwicket
punched away wide of midwicket for one
overpitched, digs it out for one
starts with an offcutter, beats the edge outside off
shuffles across to try to slog this from outside off, gets a bottom edge for one to leg
short of a length, on off, punched away past midwicket
moves across again, McKay manages to bowl wide of him without getting wided, pushed to cover
and again he doesn't let Taylor get leg side of the ball, pushed to gully
full outside off, squeezed out to deep point for one
flicked away from in front of off, deliberately in the air, and over square leg. By the time deep midwicket comes around they take three to the bigger half of the outfield
length ball, middle and leg, hit to midwicket
slower short ball, Maskadza sets himself up for the pull but is early into the shot, and manages no contact
short of a length, just outside off, cramped on the forceful shot, ends up hitting it back to the bowler
backs away to punch this on the up, but can't beat mid-off who is at the edge of the circle
chips this over mid-on. Never wanted to hit a six, just enough to clear the felder in the circle. Oram chases and throws himself at the ball to save one run
top shot. This is a heavily packed off-side field, but Taylor moves across to get close to the line of this full and wide delivery, and drives it past extra cover. All along the ground
pushed wide of cover for a single
the offcutter starts well outside off, and is called a wide
half-volley on off, driven powerfully, but finds B McCullum at short extra
pushed wide of point to bring the hundred up for Zimbabwe. Taylor has scored 75 of those, although he was a bit lazy in this single, and could have been out had Ryder hit
short of a length, on off, no room, pushed back to the bowler

What a catch. These McCullums have wings, man. Taylor tries to clear mid-off, and seems like he will do it. Nathan McCullum, though, waits for a second, and then times his jump go perfection to make this catch look easy
is that two in two? Pushed to mid-off, charges through for one, and makes it despite the direct hit
runs this down to third man for a single
makes room to blast this down to long-off for one run
slower ball gone wrong, a low full toss outside off, crashed past cover for three
works this length ball to leg for one
looks to dab this behind square, but can't beat gully
short of a length, wide, punched away to sweeper-cover for one
late-cuts this to the right of third man, comes back for two
full toss, lands on the white line that acts as the guide line for wides. Not called. I like how the umpires today have given the benefit of doubt to bowlers on tight wide calls
edged away for four. A thick one it is as he pushes at a length ball outside off. Third man is too square
guides this to third man for a single
comes down the track, pushes a length ball to long-off for one
looks to reverse-sweep this, doesn't get enough bat on it
comes down the track to take this on the full, drives it to long-off for one
lovely shot, comes down the track, chips over mid-on, and it is timed well enough to hit the boundary skirting on the full
defended back

missed stumping and catch. Taibu is in a pickle as he jumps out of the crease and is beaten in the flight. Somehow he gets an inside edge onto the pad, and Watling fails to collect it. And it has deflected too far off his gloves to try the stumping even
opens the face on this to get a single
short of a length, Taibu looks to play the late-cut, but delays the shot too much and is beaten
looks to run this behind square, but can't beat gully
this dab is not too far from Watling but they run a quick single
charges at him, Oram follows him outside leg, he punches it down to deep midwicket for one
slower short one, pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
short of a length, on the stumps, no room, pushed back to the bowler
flighted on middle and off, Taibu tries to cut this, is cramped, manages a bottom edge
Lovely shot. This time mid-off is up, so Taibu makes room as he charges, and then chips it over mid-off. Doesn't try to hit hard, but times it so well that it clears the rope easily
pushed to cover, can't get a single
flighted on middle and off, driven back to Luke, who tries to run the backing-up non-striker out, Misses
swept from in front of middle and leg
comes down the track but can't beat straight midwicket

Nearly gone. Taibu looks to pulls this, but it is too full, and the top edge flies over midwicket. Nicol gives it a spirited chase, watching it over his shoulder, and then a desperate dive in the end. Doesn't even get a touch on it, though
no room, can't get under this short-of-a-length delivery, defends
opens the face on this, but can't beat gully. That position has saved a few singles
short, pulled away, keeps it down, gets a single
Masakadza tries to make room, Oram follows him, pulled away for a single
walks at him, and then opens the face on this short delivery. Beats gully this time
Taibu has taken a liking to Woodcock. Charges at him again, makes room, and drives him over extra cover. That's six, six and four in his last three overs
makes it six, six, four and four. This time he makes more room, takes this from outside leg, and coolly chips it over extra
three fours in a row here to go with two sixes in the previous two overs from Woodcock. This time it is a reverse-sweep, not the switch hit, but he gets enough power to clear point
regulation sweep this time, for a single to deep square
tossed up outside oeg, hits the pad with the turn, but concedes a leg-bye
full on the pads, another sweep for a single
short of a length, cramps him up, but they take the leg-bye
full outside off, moves across, gets close to the line, defends to cover

Masakadza gets into the hitting mode. This has been a cat-and-muse between these two. Hamilton looks to make room, Oram follows him, this time he stays a touch inside the line, and flicks it between fine leg and deep square
Silence. You can hear a chair creek at Queen's. Masakadza slogs across one, Oram stays straight. On a length it pitches, beats the swinging bat, and hits top of middle
length ball, into the pads, clipped away for a single
runs this down to third man for a single
jumps out of the crease, is beaten in the flight, defends
leaves the crease again, lofts it by the side of straight midwicket, and Aldridge at long-on dives to save two. He has been sensational in the outfield today
down the track to hit this to deep midwicket for one

Boy these McCullums are flying everywhere. This is short, turns a touch extra, hurries him into the an uppish flick, and N McCullum goes parallel to his left to make this catch happen. He even manages to make it look easy
flighted outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, pushed to leg, Taibu sends him back because the ball has gone close to that man Nathan
and he has steered this wide of that slip to get to his fifty, off 36 balls. That's quite handy. They appreciate it at the stadium, and Taibu acknowledges it
pushes wide of cover for one
length ball on off, pushed with soft hands, wide of mid-off for one
soft hands again, wide of long-on, they come back for two
steered wide of the wide slip for one
length ball, on the pads, driven to midwicket, and the overthrow allows them a second
tossed up outside off, slow through the air, turns a bit, defended to cover
another forward-defensive
full, middle and leg, hit back to the bowler
length ball, turning in towards middle and off, pushed to point
forward-defensive, gets a thick edge to gully, on the bounce
defended to wide of cover for a single
length ball wide outside off, angles further away, beats the drive, called a wide
closer to off, opens the face on this, can't beat point
looks to punch this square, is beaten by the angle. A slip waits
length, on leg, Waller flicks him over midwicket. Waller needed that after a string of dot balls
short and wide, and smashed away. That's a whip of a cut. Between point and cover-point. That 7-2 field is making him bowl wide of off
driven with an open face, gets a single to sweeper-cover

These McCullum brothers have magnets or what? Poor analogy because the ball is not metal. Anyway, another catch for the McCullums, and what a big wicket. Taibu looks for the inside-out drive, hits it uppishly, and B McCullum dives to his left to take this. That's four catches between the brothers out of the five wickets to fall
short of a length, pushed to cover
moves across the line, gets inside the line, works this square for a single
flighted outside off, Chigumbura defends
short of a length, punched away, N McCullum makes a diving save at short midwicket
punched on the off side, and this time he finds B McCullum at short cover
big appeal for a catch at the wicket. This one doesn't turn in, beats the edge, but doesn't hit it
short of a length, outside off, punched away square for a single
flighted on middle and leg, defended back to him
tossed up straight again, pushed to short cover
quicker, now, Elton looks to punch, is hurried into it, gets a bottom edge
flighted on off, pushed to long-off for one
another lovely chip shot, Zimbabwe have done really well with this shot. He stays his ground, gets a full delivery, gets under it, and lofts it over extra cover
length ball, middle and leg, turned to leg for a single
flighted outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
quicker one, punched straight to short midwicket
flighted, dips at him, pushed back to Nicol
Elton tees off now. This is flat and full, and he gets under it to loft this over long-on. High back-lift, the back leg goes down to give him the power
full, on the toes, worked away for a single to deep square
length ball, middle and off, helped away to short midwicket
length ball, hit on the up, powerfully too, Oram gets a foot on it, probably saving three runs
looks to run this short-of-a-length fine, it beats the open face, and misses the off stump not by much
gets bat on this for a single to third man
the flying McCullums again. This is hit powerfully down the ground, but N McCullum doves full length to his right to save a sure boundary
a frustrated Chigumbura heaves across the line, is early into the shot, and is hit on the pad
length, on the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, outside off, cut away to deep point
slower through the air, this is worked wide of deep square, and they take a second on the throw
overpitched outside off, Waller goes over midwicket. The game is alive still. Clean connection, well over midwicket
defends this one to off
pushes this one through, Waller opens the face at the last moment, gets a single to cover
misses the yorker by inches, pushed to short midwicket
Lovely stroke, straight from a Test match. Half-volley on off, caresses it between cover and extra cover
short of a length, looks to dab it, gets an inside edge towards the keeper, takes the quick single, Watling's overthrow finds mid-off
yorker on off, dug out to cover

caught on the back foot to a length ball, playing across the line too, and it naturally draws a big appeal. That hits him on the back foot, on the thigh pad, but he is inside the crease. marginally outside the line, if anything. That was a borderline call
back to bowling full, hit wide of mid-on for a single
and Chigumbura picks the slower ball very early, and smashes the length ball well over midwicket. This game is on
looks to make room, the offcutter follows him, the inside edge allows him a single to square leg
yorker on off, squeezes it out, it is timed really well, but Williamson dives all over it at point. That's minus three on his fielding scorecard
punched on the up, can't beat Ryder at backward point
slower ball, middle and leg, soft hands, pushes between the two leg-side deep men, comes back for two
driven to mid-off who is at the edge of the circle, and they take the single
length ball outside off, driven past the diving Guptill at cover

dropped by Taylor. He didn't pick it. This could have been a story he would gladly narrate at bars. Once upon a time we were struggling to defend 329, I moved into the slip in the 39th over, and that catch turned the game. Except I didn't pick the ball and dropped it. Sorry, Andy
looks to runs this down again, beaten outside off
short of a length, bludgeoned to mid-on
flat, mis-hit for four. On the up, clears the front leg, muscles it. Off the inside half it goes, between mid-off and mid-on
slogs across the line of a short-of-a-length delivery, beaten by the angle
flighted outside off, pushed into the covers
short of a length, pushed wide of cover
McCullum oversteps. That's a sin. Short too, pulled into the leg side
Chigumbura accepts the gift. Makes room, and lofts this full ball down the ground. Feet short of being a six
offbreak, on the pads worked away for a single to leg
moves across to get inside the line of a full delivery, but finds short fine leg. What a fifty this is for Waller
Chigumbura is on fire at the other end. Gives him the half charge, doesn't get too close to the pitch of the flat, and lofts this for a flat six over long-off. Asking rate under seven now
short of a length, on off, beaten as he looks to run this down
loose delivery, full, on the pads, nicely glanced away for a fine boundary
short of a length, pushed to point, Waller sends Elton back, Ryder misses. Would have made it anyway
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single to deep square
full, on the pads, pushed to mid-on for one
another lovely shot, riskless too. Length ball, on off, he stands still and lofts it over mid-off. That's 10 off the over without a shot in anger. Looking easy now

Drama. Moves across the line, and he hits the pad and appeals. Not given out, but Waller takes the focus away from lbw appeal as he goes for a leg-bye. Watling removes the bails, and this is as tight can tight be. The low frame rate and the bails' being coloured the same as the stumps doesn't help. He is in by half a frame, and the lbw appeal seemed just as close to me. Watling is hurt as he dives to make this throw and runs into the bat of Waller
placed between deep square and fine leg for two
short of a length, on off, drops and runs
a near yorker, pushed to mid-off for one
short of a length, outside off, punched away to sweeper-cover for one
fuller, on a length, just outside off, hit back to Aldridge for the rare dot ball
yorker outside off, squeezed out to deep point for one
short of a length, outside off, hit to the right of deep point, into the bigger half of the ground, and despite Nicol's accurate throw they make it back for two
Chigumbura is on fire right now. Short of a length, outside off, he lines it up, and pulls it off the front foot. Well over deep midwicket. Conferences happen on the field as the crowd goes mad
low full toss, digs it out for a single to mid-on
lovely shot, Zimbabwe are running away with it. Half-volley on the pads, he plays the pick-up over midwicket - the partnership is now 100 off 72
wide outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short of a lenght, on off, opens the face for an easy single
short and wide, cut away in front of square, Woodcock at cover makes a diving save at the cover right, to his wrong side that too
tries the rare ugly swipe to a full ball, that late inside edge saves him from a plumb lbw
short of a length, punched away square, but straight to cover-point. There are four men on the cover ring to save ones
steered to the right of third man, and they steal the second
length ball, chipped down to long-on for one
short of a length, on off, pushed wide of point for a single
short of a length, punched on the up, gets a single to deep cover
pushed to deep point for another single, that's all they need
full toss, driven down the ground for a single
the nervous moment arrives. Pushed to cover. Waller wants one, then he doesn't want it. Then he wants it, by then Elton is not interested. Even this, though, gets them an overthrow
tennis-ball bouncer, and it's called a wide

Oh what have you done Elton? Length ball all right, but he swipes across it, the head falls away, the bat swings down the wrong line, and the middle stump is uprooted. The usually soft-spoken Oram has a lot to say now. Not sure if it is directed at Chigumbura
length ball on the pads, worked away for a single
length ball, accurate, the bat comes down late, hit straight to straight extra cover
poor poor cricket from Meth. Charges at him without any purpose. Woodcock bowls a straight length ball, he wafts down the wrong line, and is bowled. Mindless really
short of a length, defended
jumps out of the crease, yorks himself up, hits it back to the bowler
Where are their brains? He tries the huge slog sweep as Waller watches on from the other end. That has missed the off stump by not much
short of a length, outside off, pushed behind square for one
wide down the leg side, they are appealing to prevent the wide I think because the bat is miles away. Not called a wide. Perhaps it hit the pad
short of a length, accurate, no room, hit back to Oram. Pressure now
Waller needs to have a word with this man paying crazy strike. Backs away even before Oram hits the delivery stride, and then swings almost eyes closed. Misses the short ball
this time the back swing stays low, Oram hits the pads, and concedes a leg-bye
length ball on off, played with an open face, to the left of deep point, comes back for two. Not farming the strike. He is telling Natsai he trusts him. The ball now is in Natsai's court
this is a crazy match. Natsai has been dangerously swinging and missing, but this time he connects, lofting him over long-on. The crowd find their voice again. That wasn't the smartest move, though
punched to long-off now, the most sensible shot he has played all day
quick ball, he misses on the flick, hit on the pad
works this away fine, Ryder makes a diving save to his right, at short fine leg
Stunned silence again. Natsai jumps out of the crease and swings blindly again. Middle stump knocked over. Woodcock is elated, Waller looks on
full, on the pads, defends, over to Waller for the next over
short of a length, cut away to sweeper-cover, New Zealand won't mind the single
short of a length, into the pads, helped away with the angle for a single to fine leg
Waller keeps the game alive. Short and wide, he goes for the upper-cut, deliberately to miss point. Is he the iron man?

Waller moves into the 90s, the crowd find back their voice and their moves. This is turning out to be a poor over. Length ball on the pads with short fine leg up. Waller says thank you very much and flicks him over that man
full and straight now, hit to long-on, gives Price just the one ball to survive
Price is a champ. Digs out a yorker, and belts out a NO. Clear thinking
fired down the leg side, Watling does well to collect this. Target down in singe figures
full on the pads, hit to Taylor at midwicket, Price is sent back, Taylor fires in a throw and misses. N McCullum runs from mid-off to back up and save one
short of a length, punched away square for one
full and straight, hits him on the pad, Ryder is really close at short fine
swept away crisply, takes a single amid huge cheers from the crowd
into the pads again, helped away to the left of short fine and to the right of deep square. Easy two. This is sensible stuff
no, he has worked too hard to risk it in one low-percentage shot now. He pushes this to long-off for one, and keeps strike

Taylor has put down a half chance and is down on his haunches. Slower short ball, mis-hit towards midwicket, high to Taylor's right, who leaps, outstretches his right hand, touches the ball, but can't hold onto it. What's more? He has parried it wide of long-on to allow the second
Taylor has choked. He has dropped Waller thrice. This is a dolly. Taylor had just moved to short midwicket, and Waller hit straight at him. Out through the hands
yorker, hit to short midwicket, sent back

the game stays alive, but Price might have done just enough. Short of a length, Price tries to clear the leg-side field. The top edge goes nowhere, but Waller makes sure he moves to the striking end by the time the catch is taken

Waller does it as coolly as he has done in the rest of his innings. Short of a length, outside off, pushes it with an open face, past short cover, between point and cover-point, and yes they run like hell. I wonder if he thought of hitting a boundary to get the hundred? Who cares? Zimbabwe have won. Their biggest chase ever
